lead_paragraph: The California Highway Patrol knew dust was obscuring visibility on Interstate 5 three hours before a chain-reaction collision killed 17 people last month, according to recorded reports of radio dispatchers. Sgt. Ted Eichmann today defended the highway patrol's actions in the Nov. 29 storm and said that "we're not doing anything differently" as dust storms again swept over stretches of the highway.

headline.main: 3 Hours Before 17-Death Pileup, Officers Reported Dust Problems
